abstractText: Two folios of an illuminated black-paper manuscript of the Saptavāra (containing only the end of the Vajravidāraṇā and the beginnig of the Gaṇapatihṛdayā). The Saptavāra ‘Seven Days’ usually incorporates the Vasudhārā, Vajravidāraṇā, Gaṇapatihṛdayā, Uṣṇīṣavijayā, Parṇaśavarī/Prajñāpāramitā, Mārīcī, and Grahamātṛkā. This collection associates each dhāraṇī with a specific day of the week, a tradition going back to at least the sixteenth century in Nepal.
